EDITORS COMMENTS

This view of Stockholm, created by Danish Expressionist artist Isaac Grünewald in 1917, showcases the enchanting beauty of Sweden's vibrant capital city. Grünewald, born as Isaak Hirsche, was a prominent figure in the Danish art scene during the early 20th century, known for his expressive and colorful oil paintings that embodied the Modernist and Expressionist artistic movements. The painting, titled "Stockholm," transports us to a bygone era with its rich, saturated hues and dynamic brushstrokes. The cityscape is depicted from an elevated perspective, allowing us to take in the sprawling landscape of the urban center. The buildings, with their distinct architectural styles, are rendered in bold, contrasting colors, while the water reflects the vibrant shades, creating a sense of depth and dimension. Grünewald's mastery of color and his ability to capture the essence of a place make this painting a must-see for art enthusiasts and history buffs alike. This work of art is a testament to the artist's unique vision and his significant contribution to the artistic heritage of Denmark and Europe. Originally painted in oil on canvas, this painting is now part of the esteemed collection at Statens Museum for Kunst (National Gallery of Denmark) in Copenhagen. It serves as a reminder of the rich artistic history of Scandinavia and the enduring allure of Stockholm, a city that continues to captivate visitors from around the world.
